name: CrowdStrike Response
description:
Story to alert on, and respond to CrowdStrike alerts and events.

By default, this story will send an email containing details of each alert. The recipient can initiate response actions, such as containing the device in Crowdstrike, by clicking links in the email body.

Template formatting for Jira and The Hive incidents can be found in the 'Build Detection' agent. These can be used to quickly configure alert creation in either of those platforms.

agents.name: Search for Host Group Members in Crowdstrike Falcon

options.subject: Crowdstrike Alert
options.body:
Â 

Brought to you by Tines and Crowdstrike

Alert Overview
Priority: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.max_severity_displayname}}
Confidence: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.max_confidence}}
Hostname: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.hostname}}
OS: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.platform_name}}
Device Type: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.product_type_desc}}
External IP: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.external_ip}}
Internal IP: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.local_ip}}
Local Time: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.agent_local_time}}
Crowdstrike ID: {{.explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.device.device_id}}

Alert Overview
{% for behavior in .explode_individual_detections.individual_detection.behaviors %} Behavior {{forloop.index}} of {{forloop.length}}
Severity:{{.behavior.severity}}
Link to Behavior:https://falcon.{{.RESOURCE.crowdstrike_domain}}/activity/detections/detail/{{behavior.control_graph_id | replace: 'ctg:', '' | replace: ':', '/'}}
Process Name:{{.behavior.filename | default: 'N/A'}}
User:{{.behavior.user_name}}
Process Hash:{{.behavior.sha256}}
Command Line:{{.behavior.cmdline | default: 'N/A'}}
Scenario / Technique:{{.behavior.scenario | default: 'N/A'}} - {{.behavior.tactic | default: 'N/A'}}
IOC Value:{{.behavior.ioc_value | default: 'N/A'}}
IOC Source:{{.behavior.ioc_source | default: 'N/A'}}
IOC Description:{{.behavior.ioc_description | default: 'N/A'}}


{% endfor %}

Response Actions
Contain this device in Crowdstrike

agents.name: Create New Issue Types in Jira

send_to_stories.name: Crowdstrike - Contain Device
send_to_stories.description:
Receives a Crowdstrike Host ID, and attempts to contain that device on the network.
If configured with a Slack webhook, a notification will be sent to a Slack channel.

To configure a Slack webhook, create a 'Resource' called slack_webhook_url containing the webhook URL for a Slack channel.

agents.name: Post Message to a Slack Channel
Post Message to a Slack Channel

send_to_stories.name: Crowdstrike - Run RTR Command
send_to_stories.description:
This story will run a given Crowdstrike RtR command against a provided Host ID.

All default RtR scripts can be used, e.g.:
ls
memdump
shutdown

Additionally, custom RtR scripts uploaded into the Crowdstrike tenant can be executed as:
runscript -CloudFile="scriptName" -CommandLine=""

payload.error: {% if .start_an_rtr_session_in_crowdstrike_falcon.status != 201 %}Error Starting RTR Session - {{.start_an_rtr_session_in_crowdstrike_falcon.body.errors.first.message}}{% elsif .execute_rtr_command.status != 201 %}Error Executing Command on Device - {{.execute_rtr_command.body.errors.first.message}}{% elsif .check_status_and_retrieve_results_of_an_active_responder_rtr_command.status != 200 %}Error running script - {{.check_status_and_retrieve_results_of_an_active_responder_rtr_command.body.errors.first.message}}{% else %}No errors found when executing command {% endif %}

agents.name: Check Status and Retrieve Results of an Active Responder RTR Command
Delete an RTR Session in Crowdstrike Falcon
Start an RTR Session in Crowdstrike Falcon
